list.title: Software Developer Intern
list.subtitle: SeeByte Ltd
list.description: Working in a proof-of-concept project to monitor underwater vehicles using augmented reality. The project involved coding a cross-platform program that was able to connect to these vehicles and show them through a camera at their real-world location. This project involved high-performance code for real-time image processing in C++ with OpenCV, Java (for Android development) and using ROS for communicating with sensors.

list.title: Research Assistant
list.subtitle: Heriot-Watt University
list.description: Project funded by the Ministry of Defence which involved working with industry (SeeByte and Tekever) to develop MIRIAM, a multimodal interface for autonomous systems using Agile methodologies. This interface enables operators to interrogate vehicles using speech or text about their actions or status. I led the work on the systemâ€™s conversational capabilities such as natural language processing (for parsing, intent recognition and speech recognition), natural language generation (including text-to-speech output) and dialogue management. I also carried out customer MoD presentations and system demonstrations. Work resulted in four publications including human evaluations in simulations and with real vehicles.
